dataset.title: Nutrients in the Darß-Zingst Bodden Chain 2011-2012

creator.organizationName: University of Rostock, Biological Station Zingst, Mühlenstraße 27, D 18374 Zingst

section.para: Data set contains nutrients of9 stations from the Darß-Zingst Bodden Chain along a salinity and eutrophication gradient in the water column (upper 50 cm). Samples are taken during monthly boat trips. Data are individual values. The data of 2011 and 2012 are contributed to the EnvEurope project (action 5).

keywordSet.keyword: Completely mixed water column with reduced salinity

section.title: Dataset access and use constraints
section.para: Principal:Research has granted a permission of type:Free for access and use upon request
Principal:EnvEurope (LTER-Europe) has granted a permission of type:Free for access and use upon request
The data provider must be offered co-authorship for publications using this dataset at least within the metadata description
Formal acknowledgement of the dataset providers
The opportunity to collaborate on the project using the dataset
The opportunity to review the results based on the dataset
Reprints of articles using the dataset must be provided to the data provider

para.literalLayout: The given site contains some of the used methods as laboratory instructions to be downloaded as pdf. They were written for students practical courses. The language of this material is German (only, so far). A station methods manual is under construction. Language will be English. Note, that nutrients are measured in a continuous flow analyser, not manually. Some methods are still missing (plankton microscopy). Some methods changed recently or will be modified soon. Any user has to ask for the exact information for a specific method and time range.

methodStep.instrumentation: ammonium: indophenolblue formation, photometrically, fresh 0,45 mm filtrate, manuallyphosphate: molybdenum blue, photometrically, frozen 0,45 µm filtrate, continuous flow analysernitrite: formazan dye, photometrically, frozen 0,45 µm filtrate, continuous flow analysernitrate: formazan dye, reduction at a cadmium catalyser, photometrically as nitrite and nitrate, frozen 0,45 µm filtrate, continuous flow analyser, corrected for nitrite

section.para: Water is sampled with a Rutner sampler from the upper 50 cm of the water during monthly boat trips. Samples are transported in PE containers, cool and shaded. Sampels are treted the same daily (mostly within 6 h). 100 ml are filtered immediately through 0,45 µm cellulose acetate filters. Ammonium is incubated at once, the other sample is frozen for the 3 other nutrients. The sampling spots represent a very small spot of the respective water basins. Water mixing is investigated now.
